DataElement.preferredName: Infectious Disorder Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to questions which are necessary to allow a patient to participate in a clinical study related to disorders resulting from the presence and activities of microbial, viral, fungal, or parasitic agents as outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Infectious Disorder Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, fungal, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact. -- 2003

Concepts.definition: A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, fungal, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact.

Property.preferredDefinition: Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had a severe infection within 4 weeks prior to Cycle 1, Day 1, including, but not limited to, hospitalization for complications of infection, bacteremia, or severe pneumonia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has patient had severe infect
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had severe infections within 4 weeks prior to Cycle 1, Day 1, including, but not limited to, hospitalization for complications of infection, bacteremia, or severe pneumonia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had severe infections within 4 weeks prior to randomization, including, but not limited to, hospitalization for complications of infection, bacteremia, or severe pneumonia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a known serious active infection including, but not limited to, tuberculosis, or human immunodeficiency virus (positive HIV 1/2 antibodies)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had severe infections within 4 weeks prior to initiation of study treatment, including, but not limited to, hospitalization for complications of infection, bacteremia, or severe pneumonia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have an active, uncontrolled infection or severe infectious disease, (e.g. severe pneumonia, meningitis, or septicemia)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have an active infection requiring IV antibiotics or other uncontrolled inter-current illness requiring hospitalization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active infection requiring intravenous (IV) antibiotics or other uncontrolled intercurrent illness requiring hospitalization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active, uncontrolled infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a severe infection within 2 weeks prior to study registration, including, but not limited to, hospitalization for complications of infection, bacteremia, or severe pneumonia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have severe infection within 4 weeks prior to initiation of study treatment, including, but not limited to, hospitalization for complications of infection, bacteremia, or severe pneumonia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active infection including tuberculosis (clinical evaluation that includes clinical history, physical examination and radiographic findings, and TB testing in line with local practice), hepatitis B (known positive HBV surface antigen (HbsAg) result), or hepatitis C?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any active uncontrolled infections?

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 2023.3.6 AQT added per ticket request CADSR0002119. ak
